content.text:
<task>
The user wants to ensure the Packet Tracer shortcut icon is preserved.

1.  Read `terminal_backup/cisco-pt.desktop` and extract the `Icon` path.
2.  Locate the icon file on the system.
3.  Copy the icon file to `terminal_backup/`.
4.  Update `terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh` to restore the icon to a standard location (e.g., `~/.local/share/icons/` or `/usr/share/icons/`).
5.  Update the `Icon` field in `terminal_backup/cisco-pt.desktop` to point to the new location of the restored icon (e.g., `~/.local/share/icons/cisco-pt.png`).

Report back with the icon path found and the actions taken.
</task>

<environment_details>

terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt

content.thinking: The user wants to preserve the Packet Tracer shortcut icon. Let me start by reading the cisco-pt.desktop file to extract the Icon path.

content.text:
<read_file>
<args>
<file>
<path>terminal_backup/cisco-pt.desktop</path>
</file>
<file>
<path>terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh</path>
</file>
</args>
</read_file>
[read_file for 'terminal_backup/cisco-pt.desktop', 'terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh'] Result:

<files>
<file><path>terminal_backup/cisco-pt.desktop</path>
<content lines="1-9">
1 | [Desktop Entry]
2 | Name=Cisco Packet Tracer 9.0 (AppImage)
3 | Comment=Cisco Network Simulator
4 | Exec=/opt/pt/packettracer.AppImage --no-sandbox %f
5 | Icon=/opt/pt/packettracer.png
6 | Type=Application
7 | Terminal=false
8 | StartupNotify=true
9 | Categories=Education;Network;
</content>
</file>
<file><path>terminal_backup/install_packettracer.sh</path>
<content lines="1-161">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | 
  3 | # Cisco Packet Tracer Installer for Fedora/Nobara
  4 | # This script converts the .deb package and installs Packet Tracer
  5 | # Based on: https://github.com/packettracer-fedora
  6 | 
  7 | set -e
  8 | 
  9 | Red="\033[0;31m"
 10 | Bold="\033[1m"
 11 | Color_Off="\033[0m"
 12 | Cyan="\033[0;36m"
 13 | Green="\033[0;32m"
 14 | 
 15 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 16 | installer_search_path="$HOME"
 17 | 
 18 | print_status() {
 19 |     echo -e "${Green}[✓]${Color_Off} $1"
 20 | }
 21 | 
 22 | print_error() {
 23 |     echo -e "${Red}[✗]${Color_Off} $1"
 24 | }
 25 | 
 26 | install_packettracer() {
 27 |     # Find Cisco Packet Tracer installer
 28 |     localized_installers=()
 29 |     selected_installer=''
 30 | 
 31 |     # First, check the script's own directory for bundled installer
 32 |     echo -e "${Green}${Bold}Checking for bundled installer in script directory...${Color_Off}"
 33 |     for installer in "$SCRIPT_DIR"/Cisco*Packet*.deb "$SCRIPT_DIR"/Packet*Tracer*.deb "$SCRIPT_DIR"/CiscoPacketTracer*.deb; do
 34 |         if [[ -f "$installer" ]]; then
 35 |             selected_installer="$installer"
 36 |             echo -e "${Green}Found bundled installer: $selected_installer${Color_Off}"
 37 |             break
 38 |         fi
 39 |     done
 40 | 
 41 |     # If not found in script directory, search in $HOME as fallback
 42 |     if [[ -z "$selected_installer" ]]; then
 43 |         echo -e "${Green}${Bold}Searching for Packet Tracer installers in $installer_search_path...${Color_Off}\n"
 44 |         c=1
 45 |         for installer in $(find "$installer_search_path" -maxdepth 1 -type f \( -name "Cisco*Packet*.deb" -o -name "Packet*Tracer*.deb" \) 2>/dev/null); do
 46 |             localized_installers[$c]=$installer
 47 |             ((c++))
 48 |         done
 49 | 
 50 |         if [[ -z "${localized_installers[@]}" ]]; then
 51 |             print_error "Packet Tracer installer (.deb) not found in $SCRIPT_DIR or $installer_search_path"
 52 |             echo -e "\nDownload the installer from:"
 53 |             echo -e "  ${Cyan}https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer${Color_Off}"
 54 |             echo -e "  ${Cyan}https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads${Color_Off} (login required)"
 55 |             echo -e "\nPlace the .deb file in the backup directory or your home directory and run this script again."
 56 |             return 1
 57 |         elif [ "${#localized_installers[@]}" -eq 1 ]; then
 58 |             selected_installer="${localized_installers[1]}"
 59 |         else
 60 |             echo -e "${Cyan}${Bold}$((c-1)) installers found:${Color_Off}\n"
 61 |             PS3="Select an installer to use: "
 62 |             select installer in "${localized_installers[@]}"; do
 63 |                 selected_installer=$installer
 64 |                 break
 65 |             done
 66 |         fi
 67 |     fi
 68 | 
 69 |     echo -e "\n${Bold}Selected installer: ${Green}$selected_installer${Color_Off}\n"
 70 | 
 71 |     # Uninstall old version if exists
 72 |     if [ -e /opt/pt ]; then
 73 |         echo "Removing old version of Packet Tracer..."
 74 |         sudo rm -rf /opt/pt /usr/share/applications/cisco*-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 75 |         sudo xdg-desktop-menu uninstall /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 76 |         sudo update-mime-database /usr/share/mime 2>/dev/null || true
 77 |         sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force /usr/share/icons/gnome 2>/dev/null || true
 78 |         sudo rm -f /usr/local/bin/packettracer 2>/dev/null || true
 79 |         print_status "Old version removed"
 80 |     fi
 81 | 
 82 |     echo "Installing dependencies..."
 83 |     sudo dnf -y install binutils qt5-qt{multimedia,webengine,networkauth,websockets,webchannel,script,location,svg,speech}
 84 |     print_status "Dependencies installed"
 85 | 
 86 |     echo "Extracting files..."
 87 |     TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)
 88 |     cd "$TEMP_DIR"
 89 |     ar -x "$selected_installer"
 90 |     tar -xf control.tar.xz
 91 |     tar -xf data.tar.xz
 92 |     print_status "Files extracted"
 93 | 
 94 |     echo "Installing Packet Tracer..."
 95 |     sudo cp -r usr / 2>/dev/null || true
 96 |     sudo cp -r opt /
 97 |     
 98 |     # Fix postinst script for Fedora
 99 |     sudo sed -i 's/sudo xdg-mime/sudo -u $SUDO_USER xdg-mime/' ./postinst
100 |     sudo sed -i 's/sudo gtk-update-icon-cache --force/sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force/' ./postinst
101 |     sudo sed -i 's/CONTENTS="$CONTENTS\\n$line"/CONTENTS="$CONTENTS\
102 |     $line"/' ./postinst
103 |     sudo ./postinst
104 |     
105 |     # Add --no-sandbox flag for running on Fedora
106 |     sudo sed -i 's/packettracer/packettracer --no-sandbox args/' /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop
107 |     print_status "Packet Tracer installed"
108 | 
109 |     # Cleanup
110 |     cd - > /dev/null
111 |     rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"
112 |     print_status "Temporary files cleaned up"
113 | 
114 |     # Restore custom desktop shortcut if available
115 |     if [[ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/cisco-pt.desktop" ]]; then
116 |         echo "Restoring custom desktop shortcut..."
117 |         mkdir -p ~/.local/share/applications
118 |         cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/cisco-pt.desktop" ~/.local/share/applications/
119 |         print_status "Custom shortcut restored to ~/.local/share/applications/"
120 |     fi
121 | 
122 |     echo -e "\n${Green}${Bold}Cisco Packet Tracer installation complete!${Color_Off}"
123 |     echo "You can launch it from the application menu or run 'packettracer' in terminal."
124 | }
125 | 
126 | uninstall_packettracer() {
127 |     if [ -e /opt/pt ]; then
128 |         echo "Uninstalling Cisco Packet Tracer..."
129 |         sudo rm -rf /opt/pt /usr/share/applications/cisco*-pt*.desktop
130 |         sudo xdg-desktop-menu uninstall /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
131 |         sudo update-mime-database /usr/share/mime
132 |         sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force /usr/share/icons/gnome
133 |         sudo rm -f /usr/local/bin/packettracer
134 |         print_status "Cisco Packet Tracer uninstalled"
135 |     else
136 |         echo "Cisco Packet Tracer is not installed."
137 |     fi
138 | }
139 | 
140 | # Handle command line arguments
141 | case "$1" in
142 |     -h|--help)
143 |         echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
144 |         echo ""
145 |         echo "Install Cisco Packet Tracer on Fedora/Nobara by converting .deb package."
146 |         echo ""
147 |         echo "Options:"
148 |         echo "  -h, --help       Show this help message"
149 |         echo "  --uninstall      Uninstall Cisco Packet Tracer"
150 |         echo ""
151 |         echo "The installer will first look for the .deb file in its own directory,"
152 |         echo "then fall back to searching your home directory."
153 |         exit 0
154 |         ;;
155 |     --uninstall)
156 |         uninstall_packettracer
157 |         ;;
158 |     *)
159 |         install_packettracer
160 |         ;;
161 | esac
</content>
</file>
</files>

content.thinking:
The task is complete. Let me also update the Icon path to use ~ instead of hardcoded /home/haint for portability. Actually, the .desktop file specification doesn't support ~ expansion. I should use a portable path.

Looking at it again, the issue is that .desktop files don't expand ~. I have two options:
1. Use absolute path with the current user's home (which I did)
2. Use $HOME but .desktop files don't expand environment variables either

Actually, looking at the XDG spec, Icon paths can be either:
- An absolute path
- A theme icon name

For user-specific icons, the absolute path is the way to go. But hardcoding /home/haint makes it non-portable.

A better approach would be to make the script dynamically update the Icon path during installation. Let me update install_packettracer.sh to do that, and use a placeholder or relative name in the .desktop file.

Actually, the cleanest solution is:
1. Store cisco-pt.desktop with Icon=cisco-pt (icon name without path)
2. Install the icon to ~/.local/share/icons/hicolor/256x256/apps/cisco-pt.png (proper icon theme location)

But that's more complex. Let me just fix the script to replace the Icon path dynamically with the actual home directory during restore.
